title: 112_hr1459
content: The Act may be cited as the "Scott Gardner Act" and pertains to the detention and removal of aliens apprehended for driving while intoxicated (DWI). Section 236 of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include provisions for aliens apprehended for driving while intoxicated or similar violations of State law. The amendment to Section 236 of the Immigration and Nationality Act allows State or local law enforcement officers to verify the immigration status of individuals apprehended for driving while intoxicated. If the individual is found to be unlawfully present in the United States, the officer can issue a Federal detainer to keep the alien in custody until conviction. The amendment allows State or local law enforcement officers to transport aliens to Federal custody for immigration offenses and be reimbursed for transportation costs. The eligibility requirement for State Criminal Alien Assistance Program (SCAAP) funding is amended to mandate that states must participate in either the program under section 287(g) of the Immigration and Nationality Act or the Secure Communities initiative of the Department of Homeland Security to enter into a contractual arrangement. Additionally, state and local enforcement of federal immigration laws is addressed. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to require states to participate in training under section 287(g) for reimbursement by the Secretary of Homeland Security. Effective dates for the amendments are specified.
